title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. C, art. 2, pt. 432 - Child Abuse And Maltreatment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. C, art. 2, pt. 432 - Child Abuse And Maltreatment

State Regulations
§ 432.1 - Definitions
§ 432.2 - Child protective service: responsibilities and organization
§ 432.3 - Child protective service: duties concerning reports of abuse or maltreatment
§ 432.4 - Education and training
§ 432.5 - Obligations of persons required to report
§ 432.6 - Requirements for written notification
§ 432.7 - Access to reports
§ 432.8 - Penalties for failure to report
§ 432.9 - Disposition of unfounded reports
§ 432.10 - Child care review service reporting requirements
§ 432.11 - Adjournments in contemplation of dismissal
§ 432.12 - Access by mandated reporters to the findings of an investigation
§ 432.13 - Family assessment response

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. C, art. 2, pt. 432

Statutory authority: Social Services Law, §§20, 34, 34-a, 153-k, 383-c, 384, 409-e, 409-f, 411, 412, 421, 422, 423.1, 424, 424-a, 424-b, 427, 446, 453, 462; Family Court Act, §§ 1012, 1017, art. 10-A; L. 1997, ch. 436

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
